alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Hart; Stephens (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 7:22PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Franklin, eastern Stephens, Hart and southwestern Oconee Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 722 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles northeast of Toccoa to 8 miles north of Carnesville to 5 miles northeast of Commerce. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hartwell, Carnesville, Toccoa, Royston, Westminster, Lavonia, Gumlog, Canon, Franklin Springs and Bowersville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
